Issues.Title: assets/example-house.jpg is missing from live and download examples
Issues.Body:
### Describe the problem that you experienced

In lesson 4, step 3 (https://angular.io/tutorial/first-app/first-app-lesson-04#step-3---create-a-test-house-for-your-app), a stub HousingLocation object is created with a photo attribute of 'assets/example-house.jpg'.

This attribute is used in lesson 7, but the image it refers to isn't in either the live or downloaded example.

### Enter the URL of the topic with the problem

https://angular.io/tutorial/first-app/first-app-lesson-07

### Describe what you were looking for in the documentation

A copy of the image to save in my local repo.

### Describe the actions that led you to experience the problem

Following the tutorial (see description).

### Describe what you want to experience that would fix the problem

Include example-house.jpg in the .zip for each step and in the StackBlitz environments.

### Add a screenshot if that helps illustrate the problem

![lesson-7](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/72242656/d20c17a7-8401-404b-89c1-bd7da6c24a5b)


### If this problem caused an exception or error, please paste it here

_No response_

### If the problem is browser-specific, please specify the device, OS, browser, and version

_No response_

### Provide any additional information here in as much as detail as you can

_No response_

Issues.Title: Property 'line' does not exist on type 'TextTrackCue'.
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

I'm getting an error because supposedly the property 'line' does not exist on the type 'TextTrackCue'.

![line3](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/21122003/f6d8dac0-ba7c-4341-b18d-27c849deafff)

Seems like someone just read this definition https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextTrackCue rather than actually looking at the existing properties.
![line2](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/21122003/fa26e58c-9ac8-43ae-a4c7-d8e70bda9b6b)

Because unless I'm very much mistaken "line" **IS** a property of "TextTrackCue".
![line1](https://github.com/angular/angular/assets/21122003/b4cd24bd-91e7-40be-bc8d-9e9d2430965b)

_No response_

but found <-- AT THIS LOCATION â€¦ Note: attributes are only displayed to better represent the DOM but have no effect on hydration mismatches. To fix this problem: * check the "JsonLdComponent" component for hydration-related issues * check to see if your template has valid HTML structure * or skip hydration by adding the `ngSkipHydration` attribute to its host node in a template Find more at https://angular.io/errors/NG0500 at validateMatchingNode (core.mjs:14377:15) at locateOrCreateElementNodeImpl (core.mjs:15324:18) at ÉµÉµelementStart (core.mjs:15223:20) at Module.ÉµÉµelement (core.mjs:15302:5) at JsonLdComponent_div_0_Template (json-ld.component.html:1:1) at executeTemplate (core.mjs:10938:17) at renderView (core.mjs:12126:13) at TemplateRef.createEmbeddedViewImpl (core.mjs:22925:9) at ViewContainerRef.createEmbeddedView (core.mjs:23190:37) at NgIf._updateView (common.mjs:3316:45) ``` ### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`) ```true _ _ ____ _ ___ / \ _ __ __ _ _ _| | __ _ _ __ / ___| | |_ _| / â–³ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__| | | | | | | / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | | | |___| |___ | | /_/ \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_| \____|_____|___| |___/ Angular CLI: 16.0.5 Node: 18.10.0 Package Manager: npm 8.19.2 OS: win32 x64 Angular: 16.0.5 ... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms ... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server ... router Package Version --------------------------------------------------------- @angular-devkit/architect 0.1600.5 @angular-devkit/build-angular 16.0.5 @angular-devkit/core 16.0.5 @angular-devkit/schematics 16.0.5 @nguniversal/builders 16.0.2 @nguniversal/express-engine 16.0.2 @schematics/angular 16.0.5 rxjs 7.8.1 typescript 4.9.5 ``` ### Anything else? _No response_

Issues.Title: Multiple Style Sheets dynamically
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request?

core

### Description

styleUrls attribute in @component decorator take array of string.
I have form control that i want to use in multiple projects but problems is that each project has its own UI style.

So I want to use different style sheets for their respective components.

### Proposed solution

`@Component({
  selector: 'app-main-index',
  templateUrl: './main-index.component.html',
  styleUrls: [false? './main-index.default.component.scss': './main-index.project1.component.scss']
})`

### Alternatives considered

here in place of false I tried 

1. class variable, not accessible here because decorator is factory configuration and class is only initialized when called
2. url base path, **.com/proj1, **.com/proj2. but problem is that window.location.pathname.startswith("/proj1"), then again factory builds first then browser and DOM comes.
3. environment variables, but each project has its own environment file
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multiple Style Sheets dynamically" (#50637)

Issues.Title: Using Hydration with i18n caused duplicated component content
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

core

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

When we enable hydration in our project, we found that if we annotate some nodes with i18n attribute in one component, the component will be rendered twice.

The sample project can fully reproduce this behavior.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/hijamoya/i18n-hydration

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
The i18n should work normally as the document said:
Angular would skip hydration for components that use i18n blocks, effectively re-rendering those components from scratch.
```

Issues.Title: proxyConfig option is not working with esbuild dev server
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "proxyConfig option is not working with esbuild dev server" (#25337)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support proxy configuration array-form in esbuild builder
Issues.Body: When using the Webpack-based browser application builder with the development server, the proxy configuration can be in an array form when using the `proxyConfig` option. This is unfortunately not natively supported by the Vite development server used when building with the esbuild-based browser application builder. However, the array form can be transformed into the object form. This transformation allows for the array form of the proxy configuration to be used by both development server implementations.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): support proxy configuration array-form in esbuild builder" (#25342)

Issues.Title: feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add preload hints based on transitive initial files
Issues.Body: When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, the pre-existing initial file analysis is now used to generate preload hints for any transitive initial files required by the application. These hints are generated for both the initial JavaScript chunks and any initial global stylesheets that may be present. These hints provide additional information to the browser so that it can start and better prioritize fetching of files needed to start the application.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "feat(@angular-devkit/build-angular): add preload hints based on transitive initial files" (#25340)

Issues.Title: Proxy fails when HTTP response contains large HTTP headers
Issues.Body:
### Command

serve

### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

15.2.8

### Description

I'm using the [dev server proxy](https://angular.io/guide/build#proxying-to-a-backend-server) to forward HTTP responses from my localhost HTTP backend to my localhost Angular application running in a browser.

Since I upgraded to Angular CLI v16, one specific response is unable to be proxied back to the browser, failing with an HTTP 500.

Running Angular CLI with an altered NodeJS option seems to solve the issue, but that's not very handy:
```
node --max-http-header-size=32768 node_modules/.bin/ng serve
```

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Generate a new Angular app with `ng new`.
2. Configure a `proxyConfig` in `angular.json`, proxying for example from `localhost:4200/api` to `localhost:8080/api`
3. Configure the backend server to respond with more than 8 kio of HTTP headers.
4. Run `ng serve`
5. Run any request that triggers the proxy redirection.
6. The proxy responds with an HTTP 500 and an "HPE_HEADER_OVERFLOW" error is printed into the terminal.

### Exception or Error

```text
[webpack-dev-server] [HPM] Error occurred while proxying request localhost:4200/api/web/diffusion-requests/search?ascending=true&orderBy=scheduledDate&pageNumber=1&pageSize=10 to http://localhost:9002/ [HPE_HEADER_OVERFLOW] (https://nodejs.org/api/errors.html#errors_common_system_errors)
```

Node: 18.16.0

OS: linux x64

Issues.Title: Installing the CLI within 30-60 seconds after its publication to npm causes error
Issues.Body:
### Command

other

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I tried to install the `@angular/cli` package but got the following error:

```
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5123669Z npm ERR! code ETARGET
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5135901Z npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for @angular-devkit/core@16.0.5.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136229Z npm ERR! notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136537Z npm ERR! notarget a package version that doesn't exist.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5151588Z 
```

The npm cli was trying to install `@angular/cli` version `16.0.5` which has `@angular-devkit/core` version `16.0.5` as a dependency. 
The problem was that the `@angular-devkit/core` package was not published yet. 

While investigating I found out that there was a 60 second window where this could happen. 

Below is a table of publish times for both packages. You can see that the `@angular-devkit/core` package is usually published 30-60 seconds later than the cli package.

| Version         | CLI publish time     | devkit/core publish time | difference
|--------------|-----------|------------|--------|
| 16.0.0 | 2023-05-03T17:54:18.493Z | 2023-05-03T17:54:49.718Z | 31.2s |
| 16.0.1 | 2023-05-10T20:07:10.642Z | 2023-05-10T20:07:56.296Z | 45.7s |
| 16.0.2 | 2023-05-17T12:28:41.824Z | 2023-05-17T12:29:24.033Z | 42.2s |
| 16.0.3 | 2023-05-25T19:33:23.528Z | 2023-05-25T19:33:51.414Z | 27.9s |
| 16.0.4 | 2023-06-01T14:14:35.093Z | 2023-06-01T14:15:39.485Z | 64.4s |
| 16.0.5 | 2023-06-07T11:15:44.494Z | 2023-06-07T11:16:44.925Z | 60.4s |

publish times are acquired using the `npm show` command:
* `npm show @angular-devkit/core time --json`
* `npm show @angular/cli time --json`




### Minimal Reproduction

Run `npm install -g @angular/cli` within 30-60 seconds after a new package has been published.


### Exception or Error

```text
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5123669Z npm ERR! code ETARGET
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5135901Z npm ERR! notarget No matching version found for @angular-devkit/core@16.0.5.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136229Z npm ERR! notarget In most cases you or one of your dependencies are requesting
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5136537Z npm ERR! notarget a package version that doesn't exist.
2023-06-07T11:16:34.5151588Z
```


### Your Environment

```text
This is not relevant (ng was not installed yet)
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: refactor(@angular-devkit/build-angular): improve initial file analysis for esbuild builder
Issues.Body:
When using the esbuild-based browser application builder, the set of initially loaded files for the application is now calculated by analyzing potential transitively loading JavaScript and/or CSS files. This ensures that the full set of bundled files is available for bundle size calculations as well as further analysis in areas such as link-based hint generation in the application's index HTML.
This also fixes a bug where non-injected `scripts` where incorrectly shown as initial files.

Issues.Title: bug(MatGroupTabs): MatTabBody content within a MatMenu does not display
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

MatTab content in a mat menu will disappear when opening and closing the menu and transitioning between tabs. I believe the animations set the visibility to hidden; however, it will get in a state where it thinks it should be hidden even though the tab is highlighted causing the tab label to be the only thing visible.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/ewu1na?file=src%2Fexample%2Fmenu-overview-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open Mat Menu 
2. Select Second Tab
3. Click outside of MatMenu to close menu
4. Open menu and rapidly select either tab (may have to repeat steps 1-4). The key is to rapidly click the tabs, the content will disappear and will not come back until a few transitions. I think the animation is hiding it and never triggering it to display

### Expected Behavior

I expect tab content to be visible when a tab is in view and selected.

### Actual Behavior

Tab content is hidden tab content should be visible

### Environment

- Angular: 16.03
- CDK/Material: 16
- Browser(s): Edge
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(MatGroupTabs): MatTabBody content within a MatMenu does not display" (#27265)

Issues.Title: bug(datepicker): Date range input by keyboard validation is incorrect
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

On a date range picker, write dates in incorrect order (start > end) like `01/01/2012 - 01/01/2011`. The component shows a validation error. After correcting the start date using the keyboard to `01/01/2010`. The error isn't removed until the end date is modified, even setting the same end date using the keyboard.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/run?file=src%2Fapp%2Fdate-range-picker-forms-example.ts
Steps to reproduce:
1. Focus on the start date field.
2. Write (keyboard input) `01/01/2012`
3. Tab to change focus to the end date input field.
4. Write (keyboard input) `01/01/2011`
5. Shift+Tab to return to the start date field.
6. The validation error is shown.
7. Write (keyboard input)  `01/01/2010` on the start field.
8. Tab to change focus to the end date input field.order.
9. The validation error is still present even when the dates are in correct order.
10. Delete anything on the end date and add what you deleted again, to have the same end date as before.
11. The validation error disappear.


### Expected Behavior

Correcting the start date on step 7 should fix validation error.

### Actual Behavior

Correcting the start date on step 7 doesn't fix the validation error.

### Environment

@angular-devkit/architect 0.1600.3
@angular-devkit/build-angular 16.0.3
@angular-devkit/core 16.0.3
@angular-devkit/schematics 16.0.3
@angular/cdk 16.0.2
@angular/material 16.0.2
@schematics/angular 16.0.3
ng-packagr 16.0.1
rxjs 7.8.1
typescript 5.0.4
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(datepicker): Date range input by keyboard validation is incorrect" (#27260)

Issues.Title: perf(material/form-field): resolve scrolling performance issues
Issues.Body:
MDC was setting `will-change` on a couple of elements which caused significant scrolling performance issues on pages with a lot of form fields. These changes reset the `will-change`, because one of the elements wasn't being animated at all and the other one was only animating `transform` which is hardware-accelerated.

Fixes #27249.

For reference, this is before:
https://github.com/angular/components/assets/4450522/923fbb24-4984-47ba-b87b-5645fd344bf6

And this is after:
https://github.com/angular/components/assets/4450522/26565ce1-662d-4c52-b3a3-a5a209027ddb
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(material/form-field): resolve scrolling performance issues" (#27251)

Issues.Title: [Drag and Drop] cdkDragHandle still ignored when it is placed inside a child component
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

As the title say, when a cdkDragHandle is used inside a child component, it's ignored and we can still drag the whole element. Also, cdkDragHandle is working correctly when defined in the same component as the cdkDrag element.

I've seen this issue: [https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13784](https://github.com/angular/components/issues/13784) but using `<ng-content>` is not an ideal solution. Also, [crisbeto](https://github.com/crisbeto) mentionned in the same issue that the Angular team was working on a fix (using a `dragRef` ?). So I don't know what exactly to do to cleanly fix this problem.

### Reproduction

[https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-t5n33x](https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-t5n33x)

### Expected Behavior

Able to move the card only using the handle.

### Actual Behavior

The card can be dragged using itself (the handle is ignored).

### Environment

Angular CLI: 14.2.10
Node: 16.10.0
Package Manager: npm 7.24.0
OS: win32 x64

... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

Issues.Title: Performance issue in Angular 15/16 Form Fields
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

Don't known / other

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

Getting performance issue in Angular 15/16 post mdc migration. It's happening on other browsers as well but is more clear on Chrome(Version 113.0.5672.126 (Official Build) (x86_64)).

I have a page full of form fields (using material inputs, autocomplete, mat select, checkboxes etc).

While scrolling and some times intermittently the form fields repaints. It's only happening with Form Fields. Tried replicating same in stackblitz and it's happening for a simple input field as well, if the number of fields exeeds say 60-70. Same thing was working fine with Angular 13/14 with even 1000 input fields added.

Issues.Title: bug(table/button): Z-index and scroll issues in a sticky table
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

14

### Description

I have two bugs with a sticky mat-table and not with table with mat-table directive :

- The button's z-index has changed since version 15.0.0. The sticky and button column are both 1, which makes the button visible (but not the table background), a Workaround st z-index to 2 on sticky column.
- When I have several columns in a table with a fixed column, the fixed column also moves.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz link:  https://stackblitz.com/edit/tu9ax3


### Expected Behavior

That anything that scrolls under the sticky column is not visible and the sticky column is real sticky.

### Actual Behavior

The button is above the sticky column, and the sticky column is not really sticky.

### Environment

- Angular: 15 - 16
- CDK/Material: 15 - 16
- Browser(s): Chrome Lastest version
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows 11
